title: What's a Highrise bot and how do I get one?
content: The Highrise bot API is a powerful toolkit that enables you to add awesome features to your rooms in Highrise. These tools let you create "bots" that can perform a wide range of exciting tasks, such as hosting trivia, storing leaderboards, reading emotes, collecting tips, teleporting guests, and much more. By utilizing the Highrise bot API, you can make your rooms more engaging and interactive for you and your friends. The customization options for your bots are virtually limitless, allowing you to create unique and extraordinary experiences within your rooms. Unleash your creativity with the Highrise bot API, and transform your room into the ultimate hotspot in Highrise! Here's what you need to use the Highrise Bot API: You can create a bot via the Settings section on our website . You'll find the option to create a bot at the bottom. You can read the documentation about the bot's endpoints in the FAQ on the website . Bellow are links to BETA versions of Highrise SDKs.  They enable you to build a Highrise bot more easily. Highrise Bot Python SDK You can retrieve the room ID for a room by copying the room link that is shared from the app. So, for example, the 640532d333363a77adc6ff56 in https://highrise.game/room/640532d333363a77adc6ff56 If you have any more questions, please join the Discord and request to be added to the BETA API discussion channel.

title: Tips, Tricks, and Other Questions
content: Questions Q: How - and why - is this different from our current Design Contest? A: Concepts empowers not only our artists, but our entire community, to shape the direction of all Highrise art. An updated scoring system gives everyone a better chance to influence a Concept‚Äôs winning designs, and by sharing our staff‚Äôs designs before they‚Äôre released, we can dissolve the boundaries between ‚Äúofficial‚Äù and community designs. Concepts lets everyone share in the experience of creating and watching as your favorite items travel from idea to your closet. Q: Do we still get items, gold, and Inspired By Attribution? A: Yes! For now, we‚Äôre retaining much of the structure of our current Design Contest prize distribution. Unless otherwise stated, all winning Concept artists will receive 5 copies of each item they make and 5k gold per item. Sometimes, we‚Äôll run special Concepts with cash payouts (as in the case of Sale items). Our team will let you know what information we‚Äôll need to send your compensation. Q: I want to support my friend's design by voting for them. How do I find a specific submission? A. Every artist needs an audience who supports their creative endeavors! However, Concepts is not about seeking out specific entries. Rather, the feature was designed to help level the playing field and prevent any design from rising to the top based on the popularity of the designer. Every submission is randomly paired, which means that every single entry stands a fair chance of acheiving a high rating using the Elo scoring system. Q: You mention that Concepts can allow simultaneous Submission and Voting phases. How is that fair? Won't earlier submissions get more votes? A. Technically, yes. BUT, total votes does not equal a higher score. That's the magic of Elo! The Elo rating system is designed to predict the outcome of a matchup. If an entry is performing well, it will fall in the ranks quickly if a new contender consistently defeats it in a matchup. This allows for a newer submission to quickly gain a higher score than older submissions, if it's performing well. While Concepts does allow the possibility of a simultaneous Submission and Voting phase, for our first Concept (Artist's Lounge), we'll be keeping the two phases separate. General Guidelines WHAT TO SUBMIT Every Concept will have a brief description of the theme and item type you should create, but these are only starting points: your vision is at the heart of this feature, and of Highrise as a whole. Medium: Feel free to create your Concept using pen and paper, Photoshop, Illustrator, Procreate, or any other medium you‚Äôre most comfortable with. Re-entries: If one of your Concepts or Contest designs doesn‚Äôt get selected, you may resubmit your Concept art to any number of relevant Concepts. However, please stay on theme! Originality: Your work should be your own. Any artwork lifted from Instagram, DeviantArt, or other art communities will be disqualified, as will designs depicting copyrighted characters or other IPs. Drawing Assistance: You may use references, drawing aids, and staff-made Highrise items as bases in your Concepts. We‚Äôre looking for good ideas, which is not necessarily the same thing as good art! Redesigns: You may submit a redesign of any existing staff-made Highrise item in your Concept, regardless of the Concept‚Äôs theme. Player Items: Anyone may freely use Highrise items designed by staff as references and in redesigned items. However, you may not trace items designed by other players. Please report any designs you believe to be using player material, and our team will review the submission. All submissions will be regarded as User-Generated Content as defined in the Pocket Worlds Terms of Service . By submitting a design, you acknowledge Highrise will own the rights to the finished items, and that your compensation will take the form of free items and/or gold. CREATE MULTIPLE SUBMISSIONS Got lots of ideas? Great! Share multiple concepts in multiple submissions. This is to help ensure that when someone views your concept, they are able to clearly identify the item they‚Äôre voting for. We‚Äôve increased the maximum number of total submissions you can create to account for the new Elo scoring system. Help us keep Concepts fair! COLLABORATIONS It‚Äôs dangerous to go alone! Take a partner - if you like. Collaborations are allowed in Concepts, but for now, collaborations are limited to dynamic duos only. If you have a partner, please have only one person submit your shared Concept, and add your partner‚Äôs name on the entry. Our messenger only supports 1-1 conversations, so please keep in mind that whoever submits your Concept will be responsible for all communication with our team. Additionally, we do not increase total compensation (items, gold) for collaborations. When dividing your prize items, we‚Äôll split your total as evenly as we can, and send any spillover items to the artist who submitted the Concept. For example, if everyone gets 5x copies of their item, the submitter will receive 3, and their partner will receive 2. Feel free to redistribute the items and gold afterward! BE REAL Attempts to artificially boost your score by offering gold or other incentives in exchange for gold is not allowed. Additionally, any other malicious behaviors outlined in our Community Guidelines (ie, witch-hunting, newsfeed campaigns against another artist, etc) may also result in your disqualification from a Concept, and possibly lead to a mute, suspension, or a ban. Tips Looking for more info on how to create Highrise items? Check out our Avatar Item Layering Guide in the FAQ for more info! Teamwork makes the dream work! When communicating with Highrise Staff through the Concepts messenger, please be respectful and remember that we‚Äôre all in this together, and all want to see Highrise continue to evolve into its best self. Worried about whether your Concept suits a theme? Don‚Äôt be! No one will ever get disqualified for trying something new, or slightly misinterpreting a Concept‚Äôs prompt. In any case, the people will decide whether your design matches a theme or not, and bubble up the best, most creative entries.

title: Communicating with the Highrise Art Team
content: If your Concept is selected, we‚Äôll open a direct line of contact with our Art Team to help you transform your design into a real item! The Concepts tool features an integrated messenger, so you won‚Äôt have to leave the app‚Äôs webpage to keep the conversation going! When the Concept ends, you‚Äôll receive a message from our team, and your winning submission will get a groovy new SELECTED banner across the top. Tap into your Selected Submission to open the messenger view. Throughout this process, you‚Äôll receive messages from our Art Team directly in your Highrise Inbox. Once you‚Äôre in the Concepts web view, you‚Äôll see a small notification bubble next to any Selected Submission with pending messages. Send our team your design notes, special requests, and additional concept and reference artwork in the Concepts Messenger. Tap the paperclip to attach additional images. Our team will share updates on how your concept is progressing and ask questions as they come up. When your concept is ready for preview, we‚Äôll share a sneak peek for your review. ‚Äã ‚Äã A Special Note for Collaborators Currently, our Messenger only supports chat with the artist who submitted the winning design. We're working to add functionality to create a multi-way chat for collaborators, but until then, please coordinate with your partner to view previews and share feedback! As a quick heads up, our production turnaround is pretty speedy. When we send previews, please share any edit requests with us as soon as possible; ideally, within 48 hours. Also, keep in mind that even if you send edit requests right away, we can‚Äôt guarantee that all changes will be implemented, due to an array of possible blockers (like technical layering issues, stylistic choices, time constraints, or significant departures from your original winning concept). The Concepts messenger will close for your winning Submission about a week after your items go live. If you have any other feedback or concerns about your items after this period, please reach out to our Support Team for assistance. After all edits are complete and your items are ready, we‚Äôll send them to you as an Inbox Gift about 48 hours before they‚Äôre due to go live.

title: How do I submit a Concept?
content: Navigate to the Concept theme of your choice, and tap the Upload Submission button to begin. Creating your Submission You‚Äôll be prompted to Upload Photos from your library, camera, or files. You can upload up to 5 images per Submission. The number of total Submissions will vary per contest, but will typically land around 10 or so. Consider each Submission a separate entity. For example, if the Concept you‚Äôre entering asks for a face item, and you have created designs for eyes, lips, and a nose, use one submission for each item. This is to help keep the Concepts process more fair, clear, and easier for everyone to actually pick the items they want! Once you‚Äôve chosen the photos for your Submission, you can either add more, or delete from your current selection. If you‚Äôd like to reorder your images, you‚Äôll have to delete and reupload your photos in the proper order. Entering Your Submission When you‚Äôve finalized the images you‚Äôd like to use for your Submission, you‚Äôll be given a preview. Tap Create. You can view your submissions any time from within the Concept card page. Add another entry by tapping the + sign. Change your mind about a submission? Navigate to My Submissions, tap on the entry you‚Äôd like to delete, and tap Delete Submission. FAQ Q: I‚Äôm getting an error when uploading! What went wrong? A: First, be sure to check your internet connection. We know, this is a boring tip - but it‚Äôs often the issue! Next, try to exit out of the Concepts page and re-enter the My Submissions portal to confirm your entry isn‚Äôt there. Finally, be sure to check that all your image size does not exceed 5MB. Q: I have more than 10 concept ideas! Can my submissions show all my ideas at once? A: Um no. Help us ensure that voting is accurate! Please keep each submission limited to one concept apiece. For grabs, this means using one Submission per grab concept; in the case of single-item Concepts, each item should be its own submission. You can still use a clothed avatar as a model for your design, and share multiple examples of how it might look with different outfit combinations. However, your first slide should always clearly label or highlight your actual design. Q: Can I edit my Submissions after voting has begun? A: You won‚Äôt be able to update the images in a submission after you create it. If you need to change the artwork or order of your slides, you‚Äôll have to create a new Submission. Accidentally delete a concept after the submisison period is over? No worries! Reach out to our Support team. We can restore your deleted submission!

title: How do I vote on Concepts?
content: When you vote, you‚Äôll be presented with two random designs. If a design has more than one image, view additional slides by swiping right-to-left. Pick your favorite! Tap on an entry to select it, and tap again to confirm your choice. After you confirm, you‚Äôll be presented with a new pair of concepts. Votes are infinite, so keep reviewing concepts as long as you‚Äôd like - or until supper calls ü•™ FAQ Q: How are votes counted in Concepts? A: This tool uses ELO rating! This style of scoring gives each entry a score that increases and decreases depending on its total wins over a series of matchups; importantly, in this system each vote carries a different weight depending on the ranks of the two competitors. For example, an entry will receive a modest impact to its score when paired against an entry with an equal rating. But if a highly voted entry is paired against a low voted entry, it will receive a bigger hit to its score - and the lower voted entry will receive a bigger bonus. This system is also what allows us to run voting alongside an open submission period, as votes are not tallied via total quantity, but rather by total score. A new, recently submitted design will always have a chance to rise through the ranks if it receives enough attention! Unless you submit like, an hour before the contest ends. In that case, good luck kid. Read more about the system here ! Q: How are designs matched up? Is it all random? A: All pairs are random. None of the following will affect pairing or order of appearance: Time of entry Current score Whether you‚Äôve seen an entry before Whether you approved or disapproved an entry Who submitted the design Q: Can I see what I‚Äôve voted for? A: Right now, we do not have a system in place for retaining an index of your votes. Additionally, there is no navigation for going back to rescind a vote, or bookmarks to revisit an entry later. Go with the flow, and let your feelings guide you! Q: Can I skip if I don't like my choices? A. Nope! The idea behind Concepts is to give every single design an equal chance of being seen. The A or B voting mechanic should bubble up the best designs over time; which means that every vote you cast matters. When voting, you're not picking the overall best entries, but evaluating two concepts side-by-side in order to share your impressions of their quality relative to each other. By voting on each entry, you help to give us an accurate read on how well the community is resonating with a particular design. Q: How do I report an entry? A: Report an entry for violating our Community Guidelines by tapping the red flag in the upper left corner. Please share a comment on why you are submitting your report in the text box, and then hit Submit to send your report to our dedicated Trust & Safety team.

title: What is Highrise Concepts?
content: Concepts is an evolved version of our current UDC (User Design Contest) tool. The Concepts hub currently lives on our website highrise.game - here, community members can view and submit item ideas for designated themes. üëâWhere Concepts departs from the UDC model is that it allows A or B voting, a different vote scoring system, and even simultaneous submission and voting. When someone wants to view and vote on the submitted artwork for a Concept, they‚Äôll be presented with two entries at once, and will choose their favorite between the two. Yes, this is just like our Style Challenge voting! Also like our Style Challenges, scoring will be determined through ELO rating . Not only is this system a better indicator of what resonates with the community, but it also allows us to open any concept‚Äôs submission period to run concurrently with its voting stage (since submitting early to gain more votes is no longer an issue). Additionally, this system elevates art based on the merit of the design alone. By reducing the impact of a player's popularity on their total votes, lesser-known creators have a better chance of getting noticed. ùôèùôùùôö ùôíùôÉùôî: In keeping with our vision of a Highrise entirely built by the community, we want to move toward a future where content moves in a transparent pipeline from sketch, to vector, to real item, with your innovation, intuition, and insight as key influences every step of the way. Concepts lets you take a far more active role in choosing what kind of content gets released. By participating in the scoring process and bubbling up the best designs, you can let us know early on if a concept is in high demand and should be put into production. Additionally, our Art Team will be using HR Concepts to submit their own art sketches to the voting pool, so we can all collaborate as a community on what kinds of looks we like the best. We‚Äôre imagining a future where everyone can get involved in choosing what gets released!

title: Highrise Events General FAQ
content: What happens in an event? In events, you can compete to earn limited-edition prizes every week. Participate in each event's unique play style to win tickets, the more tickets you earn, the more you win! What are the different types of events in Highrise? Highrise features three main event styles: Style Challenge : Compete as a Model or Judge in fashion challenges. Prank : Engage in playful pranking for rewards. Donate : Collect and donate items to NPCs. How do I earn tickets for playing events? You can earn tickets by participating in event activities, that vary depending on the event type. Why should I earn tickets? For prizes! The more tickets you accumulate, the higher your rank and the better the rewards. Party Time What is Party Time? Party Time is a special ticket bonus buff that occurs every 6 hours. During this 30-minute time window, you earn a 30% bonus on tickets. In Prank and Donate events, you can use Rocket Fuel to start Party Time anytime. Note that Rocket Fuel stacks to your current party time amount but does not reset your next party time bonus buff cooldown. Event Shop & Item Collections What can I buy in the Event Shop? In the event shop, you can purchase batteries for energy refills, Rocket Fuel for Party Time, Magic Glasses for Style Challenge, and Helper Items for Prank and Donate events. What is the Lucky Wheel? You can spin the Lucky Wheel during an event for a chance to win event items, the same ones you‚Äôd find in the event shop! Boosts How do I get boosts? Spend Lucky Tokens on the Boost bar Obtain items from the event‚Äôs grab that offer boosts Do all items contribute to boosts? No: only items with an indicator displaying a boost for a particular event will provide bonus tickets. Usually, we offer 1-3 boosted event grabs, and boosted items may also be found in special event sales. For Prank & Donate events you can find items in our lucky grab that offer boosts as well, though these will only contribute a max of 4 lucky token items to your boost. Account-bound items obtained via Promo Tokens do not contribute towards your boost. Note: there is a maximum 20-item limit for combined boosts, and boosted items are NOT tradable during events! Items with boost become tradable after the event ends Ranks and Rewards How are rewards determined? Most events offer rewards in these categories (based on ticket count): Participation Individual Ranked Crew Ranked In Style Challenges, Individual Ranked rewards are broken down further into Model and Judge Rewards. Respectively, these are earned by achieving a high approval rating for your modeled outfit, and for consistent performance in the Judging portion of the event. Common Issues & Questions Boost items not counting? Boost is calculated from your top boosting items; account-bound promo items don‚Äôt count. There is also a maximum cap on boost, this cap may vary each event and will always be displayed on the event HUD. Do lucky tokens expire? Yes, any lucky tokens left over when an event ends will expire and not carry over to the next event. So make sure to use them up! If I leave my crew, do my tickets carry over? No, if you leave your crew, and join a new crew, your ticket contribution will start at 0 in your new crew. Can I kick someone from my Crew during an event? No, you cannot kick crew members during an active event. This is something we have in place to prevent abuse. If you'd like to read guides going over specific event types, just click the event you're interested in below: Style Challenge Donate Prank

The cost to spin these exclusive grabs may vary from time to time. All items obtained from these grabs are tradable in-game!

title: How do I purchase a Highrise Creature?
content: ‚ö†Ô∏è Warning: Purchasing Highrise Creatures is done at your own risk. Blockchain technology is still new and evolving, and there is a risk of scams and other malicious activities. Please stay informed about basic security measures, such as using strong passwords and two-factor authentication, and only use services from trusted sources. To purchase a Highrise Creature Club NFT, you will need a Metamask wallet, crypto currency, and to be informed about the basic security measures of the blockchain technology. ‚Äã You can follow the steps below: Step 1: Create a Metamask Wallet A MetaMask wallet is like a digital bank account for your crypto currency. It allows you to store and manage your ETH (Ether) and other digital tokens in a secure, easy-to-use way. You can use your MetaMask wallet to purchase Highrise Creature Club NFTs and access all the perks and benefits that come with being a part of the club. You should use a computer to use and create a MetaMask Wallete. It's the easiest and most safe way, and you should follow these steps: Install the MetaMask browser extension from the official website ( https://metamask.io ) or from the Chrome Web Store. Click the MetaMask icon in your browser to open the extension. Click the "Create a Wallet" button on the welcome screen. Enter a strong password to protect your wallet and click "Create". title: Highrise NFT Safety Tips
content: As a holder of Highrise Creature Club and Highrise LAND NFTs, it's important to stay vigilant against common scam tactics. Some common scam practices include: Impersonation of staff and/or trusted community members accounts in the Highrise Discord Server: ‚Äã ‚Äã Oftentimes, scammers will attempt to mimic profile photos, banners, and usernames of official staff accounts and/or well known members of the community. They will then attempt to reach out to you privately and ask that you to verify your NFT to ensure authenticity. They may also attempt to offer middleman services or offer assistance with the buying and selling of your NFT. All of which are common scam tactics. An example is listed below: Be sure to compare Discord usernames, Discord join dates and mutual servers. Always verify who you're speaking to within the Highrise Game to ensure you're communicating with the same person on Discord! Multibridge/Suspicious Links: ‚Äã ‚Äã When attempting to sell your Highrise Slime Blob or Highrise Creature through the Official listing sites (Immutable X Marketplace, Blur, or TokenTrove), someone may reach out and claim that they are attempting to purchase your asset but are unable to and instead, receive an error. They may attempt to convince you that you haven't updated your wallet and in order to go forward with the sale, you'll need to connect your wallet to a website such as MultiBridger and send you a screenshot that appears similar to the ones shown below: By going to this website and connecting your wallet, you are granting the scammer complete access and control. They will drain your wallet of all assets and funds, leaving you with nothing. Avoid connecting your wallet to any website that is sent to you via private message! Only use the Official links provided through the Official Highrise Discord Server or through the Highrise Creature Club and Land Helpshift guides in-app. False Collections: It's important to ensure that you're using the official links provided in the Official Highrise Discord Server or through the Highrise Creature Club and Land Helpshift guides in-app to protect yourself from false collections online. False collections are collections that look identical but don't actually provide you with the NFT and associated benefits. It's simply a screenshot from the official collection. You may notice false collections advertise for the Highrise Creature Club and Highrise Land NFTs on Opensea for a cheaper cost. The original Highrise Creature collection is stationed on a layer-two blockchain system such as Immutable X and TokenTrove. They are not available on Opensea. ‚Äã Any Highrise Creature Club collection that is listed on Opensea is fake and will result in the loss of your funds if purchased! ‚Äã Trust Trades: ‚Äã ‚Äã Trust Trades involve taking another person's word as a verbal promise to follow through with the terms that both parties agreed upon. This may include trusting that funds, in-game items, or an NFT will be sent  without the use of an Official Marketplace. Some players will involve a third party "middleman" to participate by holding the NFT and/or funds until the terms that are agreed upon by the buyer and seller is complete. Be cautious when choosing to participate in a Trust Trade. If using a middleman, make sure the middleman is legitamite by verifying who they are through the Highrise platform and not just within the Official Highrise Discord Server. ‚Äã ‚Äã Impersonation of staff accounts or trusted members of the community is very common! ‚Äã It's always best to purchase or sell your NFT using the official marketplaces outlined in the Official Highrise Discord Server or through the Highrise Creature Club and Land Helpshift guides in-app. ‚Äã By participating in trust trades, you risk being scammed. Although someone may appear trustworthy with other community members vouching for their authenticity, it's not unheard of for people to gain trust by establishing a good reputation and in turn, decide to start scamming later on. Sharing Private Keys or Seed Phrases: Be aware that sharing your private key or seed phrase is similar to sharing the password of your an account. By sharing your private key or seed phrase, you are granting full access to your wallet to allow for any funds of assets to be transferred out of your wallet and into a scammer's wallet. NEVER share your private key or seed phrase with anyone! It is not a requirement to buy, sell, or trade an NFT. Also, by allowing someone to create a wallet and give it to you also provides them permanent access to this wallet! ‚Äã If you ever suspect that your wallet may be compromised, immediately create a new wallet through Metamask and transfer all of your funds and NFTs to the new wallet! ‚Äã Recap: Be aware of impersonation accounts - always verify who you're speaking with. Do not click any links provided to you by another person. Always use the official links provided. Be aware of false NFT collections. Avoid participating in Trust Trades. Avoid sharing your private key and/or seed phrase with anyone.

title: How to Purchase Highrise LAND
content: ‚ö†Ô∏è Warning: Purchasing Highrise LAND is done at your own risk. Blockchain technology is still new and evolving, and there is a risk of scams and other malicious activities. Please stay informed about basic security measures, such as using strong passwords and two-factor authentication, and only use services from trusted sources. To purchase a Highrise LAND, you will need a Metamask wallet, crypto currency, and to be informed about the basic security measures of the blockchain technology. ‚Äã You can follow the steps below: Step 1: Create a Metamask Wallet A MetaMask wallet is like a digital bank account for your crypto currency. It allows you to store and manage your ETH (Ether) and other digital tokens in a secure, easy-to-use way. You can use your MetaMask wallet to purchase Highrise LAND and access all the perks and benefits that come with owning a plot of LAND. You should use a computer to use and create a MetaMask Wallet. It's the easiest and safest way. Follow these steps: Install the MetaMask browser extension from the official website ( https://metamask.io ) or from the Chrome Web Store. Click the MetaMask icon in your browser to open the extension. Click the "Create a Wallet" button on the welcome screen. Enter a strong password to protect your wallet and click "Create". Make sure to write down your password and store it in a safe place. Read and accept the terms of use and privacy policy, then click "All Done". You will be shown your MetaMask seed phrase, which is a series of 12-24 words that can be used to restore your wallet if you forget your password or lose access to your account. Write down your seed phrase and store it in a safe place. ‚ö†Ô∏è This seed phrase can give anyone permanent full access to your account. Losing it means losing access to your account. Anyone with access to it can also have access to all the assets stored in your wallet. No one will ever ask you to share this information unless they‚Äôre trying to scam you. Click the "Next" button to continue. You will be taken to your MetaMask wallet where you can view your accounts, transaction history, and other information. Step 2: Connect your wallet to OpenSea: OpenSea is the marketplace where the Highrise LAND can be purchased. Once you have created a Metamask wallet and added funds, you'll need to connect your wallet to OpenSea via a Metamask extension. Here‚Äôs how to connect your wallet to OpenSea: Visit https://opensea.io/ and click on the image of a wallet that's located in the top right corner of your screen. Press the "Connect Wallet‚Äù  button. Choose the Metamask option. A Metamask popup will show up, press ‚ÄúNext‚Äù, and then ‚ÄúConnect‚Äù. Your Metamask wallet should now be connected to OpenSea. Step 3: Add Funds to Your Metamask Wallet: To purchase Highrise LAND on OpenSea, you first need to purchase ETH (the crypto currency used to purchase Highrise LAND) After your wallet has been connected to the OpenSea website ( https://opensea.io/ ), press the wallet icon located at the top right section of your screen and press ‚ÄúAdd funds‚Äù. The easiest way to add funds is using the first option: Credit Card. Simply choose how much ETH you want to buy, and follow the on-screen steps to checkout. After purchasing, your funds will be added to your Metamask wallet instantly. Alternatively, you can purchase ETH directly through MetaMask in some countries, or by using exchange apps such as Coinbase, Gemini, Moonpay, Shakepay, Binance, and Crypto.com . If you have purchased ETH using one of these alternatives, you will need to transfer the funds from the exchange wallet to your Metamask wallet to be able to use it. The exchange app will offer a transfer option in which you'll be required to input your MetaMask wallet address to send the funds. Note: Transferring ETH requires a small gas fee to process the transaction. To learn more about gas and gas fees, check out: https://defiprime.com/gas Step 4: Purchase a Plot of LAND: Choose the LAND plot that you would like to purchase from the OpenSea marketplace ( https://opensea.io/collection/highrise-land). Even if your preferred plot is not listed for sale, you can still submit an offer and the owner can then choose to accept or deny the offer. Press ‚ÄúAdd to cart‚Äù then click on the wallet icon shown in the top right section of your screen. From there, choose your preferred payment option and click "Complete Purchase" to instantly buy the LAND parcel. Alternatively, you may click  ‚ÄúMake an offer‚Äù if you would like to offer a different price to the owner of the LAND parcel. You will be prompted to follow a series of on-screen steps. ‚ö†Ô∏è Unlike Creatures which were launched through Immutable X [a layer two blockchain], false LAND Collections can exist on OpenSea.  To ensure you're accessing the correct LAND collection, only use the official link provided above! ‚ö†Ô∏è Step 5: Connect your Metamask wallet to your Highrise account: In order to be able to see your Slime-blob pet that is connected to your LAND, as well as receive all of the in-game perks and benefits, you'll need to connect your Metamask wallet to your Highrise account. Head to highrise.game and log in using your usual in-app login credentials for your Highrise account. Click over on your profile picture in the top right of the navigation bar. Then click on Settings. You‚Äôll see a section called Blockchain, press the Connect Metamask Wallet button. A Metamask popup will show up, press Sign. After that your Wallet will have been connected successfully. üéâ Now that you've integrated your crypto wallet, you'll be able to acquire in-game perks and benefits for owning a plot of LAND. This means that you'll be eligible to enter exclusive giveaways, receive random airdrops and even equip your Slime-blob pet to roam the Highrise universe at your side! Your Pet will appear in the first tab of your Highrise clothing inventory. ‚Äã ‚Äã You will automatically start receiving all of the benefits and perks for owning a plot of LAND  for as long as your Metamask wallet containing at least one plot remains connected to your Highrise account. Note: At this stage in the development of LAND, access to individual plots is not currently available to the owner. However, LAND owners will still acquire various in-game benefits by having their wallet with their LAND asset connected to Highrise!

title: How to create Estates
content: Level up your LAND! Creating an Estate gives you a few extra creative & promotional perks, including bigger rooms, customized thumbnails, and direct, personalized URL links to your world. Ready to start building? Getting Started First, make sure you have connected a wallet to your Highrise Account. You can find more details on how to connect ImmutableX to Highrise in the other FAQ in this segment, titled " How do I create and link a wallet to my Highrise account? " Second, check what kind of LAND you own: only L1 LAND is available for Estate creation. This means that your LAND parcel must live on the blockchain. Any LAND acquired using Highrise LAND Deeds was not originally minted on the blockchain, so it won't be eligible for Estate creation. Please note that gas fees are required in order to create your Estate. Third, note the quantity of LAND required for each Estate. Here are the available dimensions of LAND Estates and the parcels you'll need to create them: 3x3 6x6 9x9 12x12 Create your Estate Log in to highrise.game on web and navigate from the Inventory or Map to your LAND Info menu and hit "Create Estate." Follow this link directly to the Estate creation page: https://highrise.game/estate/create Next, select which LAND parcels you'd like to use for your Estate in the Map view; parcels will be highlighted in black once selected. Once you're ready to go, hit Approve. Sign into MetaMask to Approve your Estate creation. After you've approved your Estate, you can feel free to leave the page while the request is processing. And... BAM! Come back to find yourself in possession of your very own Highrise Estate! Dissolve your Estate Not sure if you want Estate perks, or want to create an even bigger Estate using new LAND plots? Don't worry: you can dissolve your estate at any time. Head back to Inventory or Map and select the Estate you'd like to dissolve. Hit the Dissolve button. Next, sign into MetaMask to confirm the dissolution. Wow, wasn't that easy? . Add a Thumbnail We're all here for the customization, right? Give your Estate a custom thumbnail to give our Creature Island some spice! From within the Map or Inventory, select your Estate and select Edit Estate. Next, select Upload Photo Drag & drop or browse your files to find that perfect pic. You can use any of these formats - jpg, jpeg, png, or webp - but make sure your file is no larger than 90KB. Next, crop your image into a square and hit Upload > Save in order to finalize your thumbnail. Voila! You just got thumbnailed!

title: How to add LAND Parcels Purchased with Promotional LAND Deeds onto the Blockchain
content: LAND that was previously purchased during a promotional sale with LAND deeds can now be withdrawn and minted onto the L1 blockchain. This allows LAND parcels to be traded, sold or transferred on OpenSea!  [ LAND will still become accessible without completing this process but is solely connected to the Highrise account it was purchased with. ‚Äã ‚Äã Where Do I Find the Withdraw LAND Option? Head to https://highrise.game/land and log into the Highrise account that contains your plot of LAND. Click on your plot , then click "‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢" and "Withdraw LAND" option. Tip: If you're unable to locate your LAND, press the arrow in the top left corner to open up the filters menu. Then select "Owned By Me" and it should highlight your LAND. 2. Your MetaMask browser should pop up and ask you to Confirm and Sign for the transaction. Ensure you have a small amount of ETH available in your MetaMask wallet to cover the gas fees. ‚Äã [ There is no time limit to complete this process -- you can wait to do this process when gas prices are lower!] To check current gas prices, you can go to: https://etherscan.io/gastracker . The lower the number, the cheaper the cost will be! The cost reflects the amount of activity occurring over the Blockchain at that specific time. Note: This was a temporary promotional sale that occurred from May 12th-17th, 2022. [LAND can no longer be purchased with LAND Deeds at this time] .

title: What is Highrise LAND?
content: What is Highrise LAND? ‚Äã Highrise LAND is a forthcoming innovative virtual world built on a blockchain of digital tokens. Each token represents a unique and valuable land space with a distinct location and size. As a Highrise LAND owner, you'll be able to explore, expand, and develop your land space in a variety of ways. Unlock unprecedented opportunities for self-expression in a world of multifarious possibilities! ‚Äã Creature Island Creature Island is Highrise's pioneering venture into the world of virtual real estate. The virtual map is composed of 6,666 parcels. Of these parcels, 666 are designated as premium plots while 6,000 are designated as regular plots. Following the development of LAND, LAND owners will have the creative freedom to develop and manage their own virtual kingdoms. ‚Äã Types of Parcels Visible on the Map: [ highrise.game/land ] ‚Äã ‚Äã LAND: An individual parcel. Estate: Larger domains composed of multiple parcels: one owner. District: Larger domains composed of multiple parcels: multiple owners. ‚Äã ‚Äã Resources: ‚Äã ‚Äã Secondary Market to Buy, Sell or Transfer LAND: https://opensea.io/collection/highrise-land ‚Äã How to Purchase LAND: https://highrise.helpshift.com/hc/faq/172-how-to-purchase-highrise-land/ ‚Äã LAND Map: https://highrise.game/land See which Slime-blob Pet is assigned to a certain LAND here!
